p: As of today March 27, 2020, 86,499 Italian people have been found to be SARS-CoV2 (leading to COVID-19 disease) positive in terms of viral nucleic acid test results on throat swab samples after January 30, when the epidemic conventionally started based on the first documented case in our country, i.e. Mattia [1]. The latter, classified as patient 1, was asymptomatic when coming back from Germany to Codogno, his hometown, from where the infection exponentially spread to Bergamo, Lombardy, bordering regions and even further. After that he was diagnosed severe lung disease (which is typically characterized by dyspnea, respiratory rate > 30/min, <3% blood oxygen saturation, and/or over 50% lung infiltrates), hospitalized in critical condition (mostly contributed by respiratory failure, septic, and multiple organ dysfunction) and kept in the ICU for 20 days.
